column4: I cannot mount a partition : umount: /dev/sdb2: not mounted    |    umount: /backup/: not mounted   >>>>    mount: /dev/sdb2 already mounted or /backup/ busy
maybe you don't have the permissions? Had to fix mine once to mount. Look its properties / permissions.
I am root and / had permission drwxr-xr-x
Behappy: try gksudo nautilus on terminal and mount it if possible. If it works it's a permission problem. If not, i can't remenber what I did. I'm quite a noob with the CLI and permissions. :(
Behappy: last time Google saved my ass (my problem was permissions).
so what's the problem exactly? I thought you said you couldn't mount it ?...
and after the gksudo nautilus it still does not mount?
with me was the same. Everything mounting except one hd with ext3. Not sure what you mean now. Maybe somebody else can help. Post the problem again.
